parameters.name: key.workspaceId
parameters.description:
workspace_id is the ID of a workspace. The special ID ""
identifies the location where merged tags reside.

parameters.name: key.elementType
parameters.description:
element_type is the category of network element to which
this tag can be assigned.

 - ELEMENT_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: ELEMENT_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED is the default value.
 - ELEMENT_TYPE_DEVICE: ELEMENT_TYPE_DEVICE is used for device tags.
 - ELEMENT_TYPE_INTERFACE: ELEMENT_TYPE_INTERFACE is used for interface tags.

parameters.name: key.label
parameters.description: label is an arbitrary label.

parameters.name: key.value
parameters.description: value is an arbitrary value.

parameters.name: key.elementSubType
parameters.description:
element_sub_type is the sub-category of network element
to which this tag can be assigned.

 - ELEMENT_SUB_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: ELEMENT_SUB_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED is the default value.
 - ELEMENT_SUB_TYPE_DEVICE: ELEMENT_SUB_TYPE_DEVICE is used for EOS or
third-party devices discovered via LLDP/SNMP.
 - ELEMENT_SUB_TYPE_VDS: ELEMENT_SUB_TYPE_VDS is used for VMWare vSphere Distributed Switch (VDS) tags.
 - ELEMENT_SUB_TYPE_WORKLOAD_SERVER: ELEMENT_SUB_TYPE_WORKLOAD_SERVER is used for workload server
tags (such as VMWare ESXi host).
A workload server is a server/data storage device on which
the hypervisor is installed.
 - ELEMENT_SUB_TYPE_VM: ELEMENT_SUB_TYPE_VM is used for VM tags.
A VM is a software computer that, like a physical computer,
runs an operating system and applications.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description:
Time indicates the time for which you are interested in the data.
If no time is given, the server will use the time at which it makes the request.

parameters.name: key.workspaceId
parameters.description:
workspace_id is the ID of a workspace. The special ID ""
identifies the location where merged assignments reside.

parameters.name: key.elementType
parameters.description:
element_type is the element type of a tag. What should
be set per element type:

ELEMENT_TYPE_DEVICE: device_id
ELEMENT_TYPE_INTERFACE: device_id, interface_id

 - ELEMENT_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: ELEMENT_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED is the default value.
 - ELEMENT_TYPE_DEVICE: ELEMENT_TYPE_DEVICE is used for device tags.
 - ELEMENT_TYPE_INTERFACE: ELEMENT_TYPE_INTERFACE is used for interface tags.

parameters.name: key.label
parameters.description: label is the label of a tag.

parameters.name: key.value
parameters.description: value is the value of a tag.

parameters.name: key.deviceId
parameters.description: device_id identifies a device.

parameters.name: key.interfaceId
parameters.description: interface_id identifies an interface on a device.

parameters.name: key.elementSubType
parameters.description:
element_sub_type is the element sub-type of a tag.

 - ELEMENT_SUB_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: ELEMENT_SUB_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED is the default value.
 - ELEMENT_SUB_TYPE_DEVICE: ELEMENT_SUB_TYPE_DEVICE is used for EOS or
third-party devices discovered via LLDP/SNMP.
 - ELEMENT_SUB_TYPE_VDS: ELEMENT_SUB_TYPE_VDS is used for VMWare vSphere Distributed Switch (VDS) tags.
 - ELEMENT_SUB_TYPE_WORKLOAD_SERVER: ELEMENT_SUB_TYPE_WORKLOAD_SERVER is used for workload server
tags (such as VMWare ESXi host).
A workload server is a server/data storage device on which
the hypervisor is installed.
 - ELEMENT_SUB_TYPE_VM: ELEMENT_SUB_TYPE_VM is used for VM tags.
A VM is a software computer that, like a physical computer,
runs an operating system and applications.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description:
TagAssignmentConfig carries the value to set into the datastore.
See the documentation on the TagAssignmentConfig struct for which fields are required.

parameters.name: values
parameters.description:
value contains a list of TagAssignmentConfig values to write.
It is possible to provide more values than can fit within either:
    - the maxiumum send size of the client
    - the maximum receive size of the server
If this error occurs you must reduce the number of values sent.
See gRPC "maximum message size" documentation for more information.

arista.subscriptions.Operation.description:
- INITIAL: INITIAL indicates the associated notification is that of the
current state and a fully-specified Resource is provided.
 - INITIAL_SYNC_COMPLETE: INITIAL_SYNC_COMPLETE indicates all existing-state has been
streamed to the client. This status will be sent in an
otherwise-empty message and no subsequent INITIAL messages
should be expected.
 - UPDATED: UPDATED indicates the associated notification carries
modification to the last-streamed state. This indicates
the contained Resource may be a partial diff, though, it
may contain a fully-specified Resource.
 - DELETED: DETLETED indicates the associated notification carries
a deletion. The Resource's key will always be set in this case,
but no other fields should be expected.

arista.tag.v2.CreatorType.description:
CreatorType enumerates the types of entities that can create
a tag.

 - CREATOR_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: CREATOR_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED is the default value.
 - CREATOR_TYPE_SYSTEM: CREATOR_TYPE_SYSTEM is used for system tags.
 - CREATOR_TYPE_USER: CREATOR_TYPE_USER is used for user tags.
 - CREATOR_TYPE_EXTERNAL: CREATOR_TYPE_EXTERNAL is used for tags created from external sources.
For E.g., vCenter

arista.tag.v2.ElementSubType.description:
ElementSubType enumerates the sub-types of network elements that can
be associated with tags.

 - ELEMENT_SUB_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: ELEMENT_SUB_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED is the default value.
 - ELEMENT_SUB_TYPE_DEVICE: ELEMENT_SUB_TYPE_DEVICE is used for EOS or
third-party devices discovered via LLDP/SNMP.
 - ELEMENT_SUB_TYPE_VDS: ELEMENT_SUB_TYPE_VDS is used for VMWare vSphere Distributed Switch (VDS) tags.
 - ELEMENT_SUB_TYPE_WORKLOAD_SERVER: ELEMENT_SUB_TYPE_WORKLOAD_SERVER is used for workload server
tags (such as VMWare ESXi host).
A workload server is a server/data storage device on which
the hypervisor is installed.
 - ELEMENT_SUB_TYPE_VM: ELEMENT_SUB_TYPE_VM is used for VM tags.
A VM is a software computer that, like a physical computer,
runs an operating system and applications.

arista.tag.v2.ElementType.description:
ElementType enumerates the types of network elements that can
be associated with tags.

 - ELEMENT_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: ELEMENT_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED is the default value.
 - ELEMENT_TYPE_DEVICE: ELEMENT_TYPE_DEVICE is used for device tags.
 - ELEMENT_TYPE_INTERFACE: ELEMENT_TYPE_INTERFACE is used for interface tags.

creatorType.description: creator_type is the creator type of the tag.

arista.tag.v2.Tag.description:
Tag holds a merge-preview or the existing merged state (if the
workspace ID is "") of a tag.

tagCreatorType.description:
tag_creator_type is the creator type of the tag
involved in the assignment.

arista.tag.v2.TagAssignment.description:
TagAssignment holds a merge-preview or the existing merged
state (if the workspace ID is "") of an assignment between
a tag and a network element.

key.description:
key identifies an assignment. The special workspace ID ""
for merged assignments should not be set here.

remove.description:
remove indicates whether to remove (true) or add (false,
unset) the assignment identified by the key if the
encompassing workspace merges.

arista.tag.v2.TagAssignmentConfig.description:
TagAssignmentConfig holds a configuration for an assignment
between a tag and a network element.
The tag assignments that belong to entities other than ELEMENT_SUB_TYPE_DEVICE
will always be present in mainline only.

type.description: This describes the class of delete error.

error.description: This indicates the error message from the delete failure.

key.description: This is the key of the TagAssignmentConfig instance that failed to be deleted.

time.description: Time indicates the (UTC) timestamp when the key was being deleted.

key.description: Key echoes back the key of the deleted TagAssignmentConfig instance.

time.description:
- it is after the time the request was received
   - a time-ranged query with StartTime==DeletedAt will not include this instance.
time.title:
Time indicates the (UTC) timestamp at which the system recognizes the
deletion. The only guarantees made about this timestamp are:

value.description:
Value is the value requested.
This structure will be fully-populated as it exists in the datastore. If
optional fields were not given at creation, these fields will be empty or
set to default values.

time.description:
Time carries the (UTC) timestamp of the last-modification of the
TagAssignmentConfig instance in this response.

value.description:
Value carries all the values given in the TagAssignmentConfigSetRequest as well
as any server-generated values.

time.description:
- it is after the time the request was received
   - a time-ranged query with StartTime==CreatedAt will include this instance.
time.title:
Time indicates the (UTC) timestamp at which the system recognizes the
creation. The only guarantees made about this timestamp are:

partialEqFilter.description:
PartialEqFilter provides a way to server-side filter a GetAll/Subscribe.
This requires all provided fields to be equal to the response.

While transparent to users, this field also allows services to optimize internal
subscriptions if filter(s) are sufficiently specific.

time.description:
TimeRange allows limiting response data to within a specified time window.
If this field is populated, at least one of the two time fields are required.

For GetAll, the fields start and end can be used as follows:

  * end: Returns the state of each TagAssignmentConfig at end.
    * Each TagAssignmentConfig response is fully-specified (all fields set).
  * start: Returns the state of each TagAssignmentConfig at start, followed by updates until now.
    * Each TagAssignmentConfig response at start is fully-specified, but updates may be partial.
  * start and end: Returns the state of each TagAssignmentConfig at start, followed by updates
    until end.
    * Each TagAssignmentConfig response at start is fully-specified, but updates until end may
      be partial.

This field is not allowed in the Subscribe RPC.

value.description:
Value is a value deemed relevant to the initiating request.
This structure will always have its key-field populated. Which other fields are
populated, and why, depends on the value of Operation and what triggered this notification.

time.description: Time holds the timestamp of this TagAssignmentConfig's last modification.

type.description:
Operation indicates how the TagAssignmentConfig value in this response should be considered.
Under non-subscribe requests, this value should always be INITIAL. In a subscription,
once all initial data is streamed and the client begins to receive modification updates,
you should not see INITIAL again.

workspaceId.description:
workspace_id is the ID of a workspace. The special ID ""
identifies the location where merged assignments reside.

elementType.title:
element_type is the element type of a tag. What should
be set per element type:

label.description: label is the label of a tag.

value.description: value is the value of a tag.

interfaceId.description: interface_id identifies an interface on a device.

elementSubType.description: element_sub_type is the element sub-type of a tag.

arista.tag.v2.TagAssignmentKey.description:
TagAssignmentKey uniquely identifies an assignment between
a tag and a network element.

value.description:

TagAssignment instance in this response.

arista.tag.v2.TagConfig.description:
TagConfig holds a configuration for a user tag.
The tags that belong to entities other than ELEMENT_SUB_TYPE_DEVICE
will always be present in mainline only.

fmp.DeleteError.description:
DeleteError defines the set of delete error types.

 - DELETE_ERROR_UNSPECIFIED: DELETE_ERROR_UNSPECIFIED indicates that the delete error
is not specified.
 - DELETE_ERROR_UNAUTHORIZED: DELETE_ERROR_UNAUTHORIZED indicates that the user is not authorized
to perform the specified delete.
 - DELETE_ERROR_INTERNAL: DELETE_ERROR_INTERNAL indicates that the server encountered an
unrecoverable error on the specified delete.
 - DELETE_ERROR_UNDELETABLE_KEY: DELETE_ERROR_UNDELETABLE_KEY indicates that the specified error is
not allowed by the service.
